member.name: M:CefSharp.IFocusHandler.OnTakeFocus(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Called when the browser component is about to lose focus. For instance, if focus was on the last HTML element and the user pressed the TAB key.

member.summary: Runs a file chooser dialog.

the title to be used for the dialog. It may be empty to show the default title ("Open" or "Save" depending on the mode).
the default file name to select in the dialog.
a list of valid lower-cased MIME types or file extensions specified in an input element and is used to restrict selectable files to such types.
member.returns: To display a custom dialog return true. To display the default dialog return false.

member.name: F:CefSharp.TransitionType.LinkClicked
member.summary: Source is a link click or the JavaScript window.open function. This is also the default value for requests like sub-resource loads that are not navigations.

member.name: F:CefSharp.TransitionType.Explicit
member.summary: Source is some other "explicit" navigation action such as creating a new browser or using the LoadURL function. This is also the default value for navigations where the actual type is unknown.

member.name: F:CefSharp.TransitionType.AutoSubFrame
member.summary: Source is a subframe navigation. This is any content that is automatically loaded in a non-toplevel frame. For example, if a page consists of several frames containing ads, those ad URLs will have this transition type. The user may not even realize the content in these pages is a separate frame, so may not care about the URL.

member.name: F:CefSharp.TransitionType.ManualSubFrame
member.summary: Source is a subframe navigation explicitly requested by the user that will generate new navigation entries in the back/forward list. These are probably more important than frames that were automatically loaded in the background because the user probably cares about the fact that this link was loaded.

member.name: F:CefSharp.TransitionType.FormSubmit
member.summary: Source is a form submission by the user. NOTE: In some situations submitting a form does not result in this transition type. This can happen if the form uses a script to submit the contents.

member.name: F:CefSharp.TransitionType.Reload
member.summary: Source is a "reload" of the page via the Reload function or by re-visiting the same URL. NOTE: This is distinct from the concept of whether a particular load uses "reload semantics" (i.e. bypasses cached data).

member.name: F:CefSharp.TransitionType.SourceMask
member.summary: General mask defining the bits used for the source values.

member.name: F:CefSharp.TransitionType.Blocked
member.summary: Attempted to visit a URL but was blocked.

member.name: F:CefSharp.TransitionType.ForwardBack
member.summary: Used the Forward or Back function to navigate among browsing history.

member.name: F:CefSharp.TransitionType.ChainStart
member.summary: The beginning of a navigation chain.

member.name: F:CefSharp.TransitionType.ChainEnd
member.summary: The last transition in a redirect chain.

member.name: F:CefSharp.TransitionType.CliendRedirect
member.summary: Redirects caused by JavaScript or a meta refresh tag on the page.

member.name: F:CefSharp.TransitionType.ServerRedirect
member.summary: Redirects sent from the server by HTTP headers.

member.name: F:CefSharp.TransitionType.IsRedirect
member.summary: Used to test whether a transition involves a redirect.

member.name: F:CefSharp.TransitionType.QualifierMask
member.summary: General mask defining the bits used for the qualifiers.

member.name: T:CefSharp.CefErrorCode
member.summary: Lists some of the error codes that can be reported by CEF.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.None
member.summary: No error occurred.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.Failed
member.summary: A generic failure occurred.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.Aborted
member.summary: A request was aborted, possibly by the user.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.InvalidArgument
member.summary: An argument to the function is incorrect.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.InvalidHandle
member.summary: The handle or file descriptor is invalid.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.FileNotFound
member.summary: The file or directory cannot be found.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.TimedOut
member.summary: An operation timed out.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.FileTooBig
member.summary: The file is too large.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.Unexpected
member.summary: An unexpected error. This may be caused by a programming mistake or an invalid assumption

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.AccessDenied
member.summary: Permission to access a resource, other than the network, was denied.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.NotImplemented
member.summary: The operation failed because of unimplemented functionality.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.ConnectionClosed
member.summary: A connection was closed (corresponding to a TCP FIN).

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.ConnectionReset
member.summary: A connection was reset (corresponding to a TCP RST).

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.ConnectionRefused
member.summary: A connection attempt was refused.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.ConnectionAborted
member.summary: A connection timed out as a result of not receiving an ACK for data sent. This can include a FIN packet that did not get ACK'd.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.ConnectionFailed
member.summary: A connection attempt failed.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.NameNotResolved
member.summary: The host name could not be resolved.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.InternetDisconnected
member.summary: The Internet connection has been lost.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.SslProtocolError
member.summary: An SSL protocol error occurred.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.AddressInvalid
member.summary: The IP address or port number is invalid (e.g., cannot connect to the IP address 0 or the port 0).

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.AddressUnreachable
member.summary: The IP address is unreachable. This usually means that there is no route to the specified host or network.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.SslClientAuthCertNeeded
member.summary: The server requested a client certificate for SSL client authentication.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.TunnelConnectionFailed
member.summary: A tunnel connection through the proxy could not be established.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.NoSslVersionsEnabled
member.summary: No SSL protocol versions are enabled.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.SslVersionOrCipherMismatch
member.summary: The client and server don't support a common SSL protocol version or cipher suite.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.SslRenegotiationRequested
member.summary: The server requested a renegotiation (rehandshake).

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.CertCommonNameInvalid
member.summary: The server responded with a certificate whose common name did not match the host name. This could mean: 1. An attacker has redirected our traffic to his server and is presenting a certificate for which he knows the private key. 2. The server is misconfigured and responding with the wrong cert. 3. The user is on a wireless network and is being redirected to the network's login page. 4. The OS has used a DNS search suffix and the server doesn't have a certificate for the abbreviated name in the address bar.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.CertDateInvalid
member.summary: The server responded with a certificate that, by our clock, appears to either not yet be valid or to have expired. This could mean: 1. An attacker is presenting an old certificate for which he has managed to obtain the private key 2. The server is misconfigured and is not presenting a valid cert. 3. Our clock is wrong.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.CertAuthorityInvalid
member.summary: The server responded with a certificate that is signed by an authority we don't trust. The could mean: 1. An attacker has substituted the real certificate for a cert that contains his public key and is signed by his cousin. 2. The server operator has a legitimate certificate from a CA we don't know about, but should trust. 3. The server is presenting a self-signed certificate, providing no defense against active attackers (but foiling passive attackers).

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.CertContainsErrors
member.summary: The server responded with a certificate that contains errors. This error is not recoverable. MSDN describes this error as follows: "The SSL certificate contains errors." NOTE: It's unclear how this differs from ERR_CERT_INVALID. For consistency, use that code instead of this one from now on.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.CertNoRevocationMechanism
member.summary: The certificate has no mechanism for determining if it is revoked. In effect, this certificate cannot be revoked.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.CertUnableToCheckRevocation
member.summary: Revocation information for the security certificate for this site is not available. This could mean: 1. An attacker has compromised the private key in the certificate and is blocking our attempt to find out that the cert was revoked. 2. The certificate is unrevoked, but the revocation server is busy or unavailable.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.CertRevoked
member.summary: The server responded with a certificate has been revoked. We have the capability to ignore this error, but it is probably not the thing to do.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.CertInvalid
member.summary: The server responded with a certificate that is invalid. This error is not recoverable.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.CertEnd
member.summary: The value immediately past the last certificate error code.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.InvalidUrl
member.summary: The URL is invalid.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.DisallowedUrlScheme
member.summary: The scheme of the URL is disallowed.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.UnknownUrlScheme
member.summary: The scheme of the URL is unknown.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.TooManyRedirects
member.summary: Attempting to load an URL resulted in too many redirects.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.UnsafeRedirect
member.summary: Attempting to load an URL resulted in an unsafe redirect (e.g., a redirect to file:// is considered unsafe).

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.UnsafePort
member.summary: Attempting to load an URL with an unsafe port number. These are port numbers that correspond to services, which are not robust to spurious input that may be constructed as a result of an allowed web construct (e.g., HTTP looks a lot like SMTP, so form submission to port 25 is denied).

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.InvalidResponse
member.summary: The server's response was invalid.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.InvalidChunkedEncoding
member.summary: Error in chunked transfer encoding.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.MethodNotSupported
member.summary: The server did not support the request method.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.UnexpectedProxyAuth
member.summary: The response was 407 (Proxy Authentication Required), yet we did not send the request to a proxy.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.EmptyResponse
member.summary: The server closed the connection without sending any data.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.ResponseHeadersTooBig
member.summary: The headers section of the response is too large.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.CacheMiss
member.summary: The cache does not have the requested entry.

member.name: F:CefSharp.CefErrorCode.InsecureResponse
member.summary: The server's response was insecure (e.g. there was a cert error).

member.summary: The message text of the console message.

member.name: P:CefSharp.ConsoleMessageEventArgs.Source

member.name: P:CefSharp.ConsoleMessageEventArgs.Line

member.name: M:CefSharp.IDownloadHandler.OnDownloadUpdated(CefSharp.DownloadItem)

member.name: M:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.Load(System.String)
member.summary: Loads the specified URL.

member.name: M:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.LoadHtml(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Registers and loads a that represents the HTML content.
member.remarks: `Cef` Native `LoadHtml` is unpredictable and only works sometimes, this method wraps the provided HTML in a and loads the provided url using the method. Defaults to using for character encoding
member.param: The URL that will be treated as the address of the content.

member.name: M:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.LoadHtml(System.String,System.String,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Registers and loads a that represents the HTML content.
member.remarks: `Cef` Native `LoadHtml` is unpredictable and only works sometimes, this method wraps the provided HTML in a and loads the provided url using the method.
member.param: The URL that will be treated as the address of the content.

member.name: M:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.RegisterJsObject(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Registers a Javascript object in this specific browser instance.
member.param: The name of the object. (e.g. "foo", if you want the object to be accessible as window.foo).
The object to be made accessible to Javascript.

member.name: M:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.ExecuteScriptAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Execute some Javascript code in the context of this WebBrowser. As the method name implies, the script will be executed asynchronously, and the method therefore returns before the script has actually been executed.
member.param: The Javascript code that should be executed.

members.member:
Execute some Javascript code in the context of this WebBrowser, and return the result of the evaluation in an Async fashion
The Javascript code that should be executed. The timeout after which the Javascript code execution should be aborted. /// A Task that can be awaited to perform the script execution

member.name: M:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.Find(System.Int32,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Search for text within the current page.
member.param: Can be used in can conjunction with searchText to have multiple searches running simultaneously.
indicates whether to search forward or backward within the page.
indicates whether the search should be case-sensitive.
indicates whether this is the first request or a follow-up.

member.name: M:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.StopFinding(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Cancel all searches that are currently going on.

member.name: M:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.Back
member.summary: Navigates back, must check before calling this method.

member.name: M:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.Forward
member.summary: Navigates forward, must check before calling this method.

member.name: M:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.Stop
member.summary: Stops loading the current page.

member.name: M:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.GetSourceAsync
member.summary: Retrieve the main frame's HTML source using a .
member.returns: that when executed returns the frame source as a string

member.name: M:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.GetTextAsync
member.summary: Retrieve the main frame's display text using a .
member.returns: that when executed returns the frame display text as a string.

member.name: M:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.ViewSource
member.summary: Opens up a new program window (using the default text editor) where the source code of the currently displayed web page is shown.

member.name: M:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.Focus
member.summary: Attempts to give focus to the IWpfWebBrowser control.
member.returns: true if keyboard focus and logical focus were set to this element; false if only logical focus was set to this element, or if the call to this method did not force the focus to change.

member.name: M:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.Reload
member.summary: Reloads the page being displayed. This method will use data from the browser's cache, if available.

member.name: M:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.Reload(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reloads the page being displayed, optionally ignoring the cache (which means the whole page including all .css, .js etc. resources will be re-fetched).
member.param: true A reload is performed ignoring browser cache; false A reload is performed using files from the browser cache, if available.

member.name: M:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.Print
member.summary: Opens a Print Dialog which if used (can be user cancelled) will print the browser contents.

member.name: M:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.ShowDevTools
member.summary: Open developer tools in its own window.

member.name: M:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.CloseDevTools
member.summary: Explicitly close the developer tools window if one exists for this browser instance.

member.name: M:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.SendMouseWheelEvent(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Send a mouse wheel event to the browser.
member.param: X-Axis coordinate relative to the upper-left corner of the view.
Y-Axis coordinate relative to the upper-left corner of the view.

member.name: E:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.ConsoleMessage
member.summary: Event handler for receiving Javascript console messages being sent from web pages.

member.name: E:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.StatusMessage
member.summary: Event handler for changes to the status message.

member.name: E:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.FrameLoadStart
member.summary: Event handler that will get called when the browser begins loading a frame. Multiple frames may be loading at the same time. Sub-frames may start or continue loading after the main frame load has ended. This method may not be called for a particular frame if the load request for that frame fails. For notification of overall browser load status use OnLoadingStateChange instead.

member.name: E:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.FrameLoadEnd
member.summary: Event handler that will get called when the browser is done loading a frame. Multiple frames may be loading at the same time. Sub-frames may start or continue loading after the main frame load has ended. This method will always be called for all frames irrespective of whether the request completes successfully.

member.name: E:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.LoadError
member.summary: Event handler that will get called when the resource load for a navigation fails or is canceled.

member.name: E:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.NavStateChanged
member.summary: Event handler that will get called when the Navigation state has changed (Maps to OnLoadingStateChange in Cef). This event will be fired twice. Once when loading is initiated either programmatically or by user action, and once when loading is terminated due to completion, cancellation of failure.

member.name: P:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.DialogHandler
member.summary: Implement and assign to handle dialog events.

member.name: P:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.RequestHandler
member.summary: Implement and assign to handle events related to browser requests.

member.name: P:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.LifeSpanHandler
member.summary: Implement and assign to handle events related to popups.

member.name: P:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.KeyboardHandler
member.summary: Implement and assign to handle events related to key press.

member.name: P:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.JsDialogHandler
member.summary: Implement and assign to handle events related to JavaScript Dialogs.

member.name: P:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.DragHandler
member.summary: Implement and assign to handle events related to dragging.

member.name: P:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.DownloadHandler
member.summary: Implement and assign to handle events related to downloading files.

member.name: P:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.MenuHandler
member.summary: Implement and assign to handle events related to the browser context menu

member.name: P:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.FocusHandler
member.summary: Implement and assign to handle events related to the browser component's focus

member.name: P:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.ResourceHandler
member.summary: Implement and control the loading of resources

member.name: P:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.IsBrowserInitialized
member.summary: A flag that indicates whether the WebBrowser is initialized (true) or not (false).
member.remarks: In the WPF control, this property is implemented as a Dependency Property and fully supports data binding.

member.name: P:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.IsLoading
member.summary: A flag that indicates whether the control is currently loading one or more web pages (true) or not (false).
member.remarks: In the WPF control, this property is implemented as a Dependency Property and fully supports data binding.

member.name: P:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.CanGoBack
member.summary: A flag that indicates whether the state of the control current supports the GoBack action (true) or not (false).
member.remarks: In the WPF control, this property is implemented as a Dependency Property and fully supports data binding.

member.name: P:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.CanGoForward
member.summary: A flag that indicates whether the state of the control currently supports the GoForward action (true) or not (false).
member.remarks: In the WPF control, this property is implemented as a Dependency Property and fully supports data binding.

member.name: P:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.CanReload
member.summary: A flag that indicates whether the state of the control currently supports the Reload action (true) or not (false).
member.remarks: In the WPF control, this property is implemented as a Dependency Property and fully supports data binding.

member.name: P:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.Address
member.summary: The address (URL) which the browser control is currently displaying. Will automatically be updated as the user navigates to another page (e.g. by clicking on a link).
member.remarks: In the WPF control, this property is implemented as a Dependency Property and fully supports data binding.

member.name: P:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.Title
member.summary: The title of the web page being currently displayed.
member.remarks: In the WPF control, this property is implemented as a Dependency Property and fully supports data binding.

member.name: P:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.TooltipText
member.summary: The text that will be displayed as a ToolTip

member.name: P:CefSharp.IWebBrowser.ZoomLevel
member.summary: The zoom level at which the browser control is currently displaying. Can be set to 0 to clear the zoom level (resets to default zoom level).
member.remarks: In the WPF control, this property is implemented as a Dependency Property and fully supports data binding.

member.name: T:CefSharp.IWebPluginInfo
member.summary: Wrapper for the CEF3 CefWebPluginInfo

member.name: P:CefSharp.IRequest.TransitionType
member.summary: Get the transition type for this request. Applies to requests that represent a main frame or sub-frame navigation.

member.name: M:CefSharp.IRequestHandler.OnBeforeBrowse(CefSharp.IWebBrowser,CefSharp.IRequest,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Called before browser navigation. If the navigation is allowed and will be called. If the navigation is canceled will be called with an ErrorCode value of .
member.param: the request object - cannot be modified in this callback
member.returns: Return true to cancel the navigation or false to allow the navigation to proceed.

member.name: M:CefSharp.IRequestHandler.OnCertificateError(CefSharp.IWebBrowser,CefSharp.CefErrorCode,System.String)
member.summary: Called when a certificate error is thrown.
member.param: the error code for this invalid certificate
the url of the request for the invalid certificate
member.returns: Return true to allow the invalid certificate and continue the request.

member.name: M:CefSharp.IRequestHandler.OnPluginCrashed(CefSharp.IWebBrowser,System.String)
member.summary: Called when a plugin has crashed
member.param: path of the plugin that crashed

member.name: M:CefSharp.IRequestHandler.OnBeforeResourceLoad(CefSharp.IWebBrowser,CefSharp.IRequest,CefSharp.IResponse)
member.summary: Called before a resource request is loaded.
member.param: the request object - can be modified in this callback.
the request object - can be modified in this callback.
member.returns: To cancel loading of the resource return true or false o allow the resource to load normally.

member.name: M:CefSharp.IRequestHandler.GetAuthCredentials(CefSharp.IWebBrowser,System.Boolean,System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Called when the browser needs credentials from the user.
member.param: indicates whether the host is a proxy server
member.returns: Return true to continue the request and call CefAuthCallback::Continue() when the authentication information is available. Return false to cancel the request.

member.name: M:CefSharp.IRequestHandler.OnBeforePluginLoad(CefSharp.IWebBrowser,System.String,System.String,CefSharp.IWebPluginInfo)
member.summary: Called on the browser process IO thread before a plugin is loaded.
member.returns: Return true to block loading of the plugin.

member.name: M:CefSharp.IRequestHandler.OnRenderProcessTerminated(CefSharp.IWebBrowser,CefSharp.CefTerminationStatus)
member.summary: Called when the render process terminates unexpectedly.

member.name: M:CefSharp.ISchemeHandler.ProcessRequestAsync(CefSharp.IRequest,CefSharp.ISchemeHandlerResponse,CefSharp.OnRequestCompletedHandler)
member.summary: Processes a custom scheme-based request asynchronously. The implementing method should call the callback whenever the request is completed.
member.param: The SchemeHandlerResponse object in which the handler is supposed to place the response information.
A callback which the handler is supposed to call once the processing is complete. The callback may be called on any thread.
member.returns: true if the request is handled, false otherwise.

member.name: P:CefSharp.ISchemeHandlerResponse.ResponseStream
member.summary: A Stream with the response data. If the request didn't return any response, leave this property as null.

member.name: P:CefSharp.ISchemeHandlerResponse.StatusCode
member.summary: The status code of the response. Unless set, the default value used is 200 (corresponding to HTTP status OK).

member.name: P:CefSharp.ISchemeHandlerResponse.ContentLength
member.summary: The length of the response contents. Defaults to -1, which means unknown length and causes CefSharp to read the response stream in pieces. Thus, setting a length is optional but allows for more optimal response reading.

member.name: P:CefSharp.ISchemeHandlerResponse.RedirectUrl
member.summary: URL to redirect to (leave empty to not redirect).

member.name: P:CefSharp.ISchemeHandlerResponse.CloseStream
member.summary: Set to true to close the response stream once it has been read. The default value is false in order to preserve the old CefSharp behavior of not closing the stream.

member.name: T:CefSharp.FrameLoadEndEventArgs
member.summary: Event arguments to the FrameLoadEnd event handler set up in IWebBrowser.

member.name: P:CefSharp.FrameLoadEndEventArgs.Url
member.summary: The URL that was loaded.

member.name: P:CefSharp.FrameLoadEndEventArgs.IsMainFrame
member.summary: Is this the Main Frame

member.name: P:CefSharp.FrameLoadEndEventArgs.HttpStatusCode
member.summary: Http Status Code
